item.title: Maps distort how we see the world
item.description: - Maps distort our perception of the world because they are 2D projections of a 3D sphere, causing distortion in size and shape.

item.title: Making Figma better for developers with Dev Mode
item.description: - Figma has introduced a new workspace called Dev Mode, specifically designed to meet the needs of developers.

item.title: GPT4 is 8 x 220B params = 1.7T params
item.description: - GPT4 is a powerful language model with 1.7 trillion parameters, which is 10 times the size of GPT3.

item.title: FTC sues Amazon over 'deceptive' Prime sign-up & cancellation process
item.description: - The Federal Trade Commission (FTC) has sued Amazon, accusing the company of deceiving customers into signing up for its Prime subscription program and making it complicated to cancel.

item.title: A regular expression to check for prime numbers (2007)
item.description: - Regular expressions can be used to check if a number is prime or not.

item.title: Apple could force a 111-year-old fruit company to change its Apple logo
item.description: - Apple is trying to gain intellectual property rights to images of actual apples in Switzerland.

item.title: Red Hat cutting back RHEL source availability
item.description: - Red Hat has announced that public source releases for Red Hat Enterprise Linux (RHEL) will be restricted to CentOS Stream going forward.

item.title: Developer tools to create spatial experiences for Apple Vision Pro
item.description: - Apple has released developer tools and technologies that enable developers to create spatial experiences for Apple Vision Pro, their first spatial computer.

item.title: Go 1.21 Release Candidate
item.description: - Go 1.21 Release Candidate (RC) is now available for download, packed with new features and improvements.

item.title: Ask HN: What is the morale like inside Reddit, as an employee?
item.description: - Readers are asking about the morale of Reddit employees and what it's like working there.
